sen.j: 蘇我入鹿（そが の いるか）は、大和朝廷の有力者。
sen.e: SOGA no Iruka was a powerful person in Yamato Imperial Court.
SOGA no Iruka was a powerful person in the Yamato Imperial Court.
SOGA no Iruka was a powerful person in the Yamato Imperial Court.

sen.j: 大臣（おおおみ）。
sen.e: Minister
Minister
Minister

sen.j: 大化の改新の前夜乙巳の変において討たれ、その後、蘇我氏が凋落するきっかけとなった。
sen.e: During the previous night of Taika Reform, he was killed in Isshi no hen (the Murder in the Year of Isshi), and afterward, the Soga clan became declined.
During the previous night of Taika Reform, he was killed in Isshi no hen (the Murder in the Year of Isshi), and afterward, the Soga clan declined.
During the previous night of Taika Reform, he was killed in Isshi no hen (the Murder in the Year of Isshi), and afterward, the Soga clan declined.

sen.j: 以下は主に『日本書紀』などの記述による。
sen.e: The following is chiefly according to the descriptions in "Nohonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
The following is mainly according to the descriptions in "Nohonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
The following is mainly according to the descriptions in "Nohonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).

sen.j: 青少年期は旻に学問堂で学んだ秀才だったと言われている。
sen.e: It is said that was a talented man who studied from Min in the knowledge temple during his youth period.
It is said that he was a talented man who studied from Min in the knowledge temple during his youth period.
It is said that he was a talented man who studied from Min in the knowledge temple during his youth period.

sen.j: 父の大臣・蘇我蝦夷の晩年の642年（皇極天皇元年）、皇極天皇の即位に伴い、父に代わって国政を掌理する。
sen.e: In AD 642, when his minister father SOGA no Emishi was in his late years, he took charge of national administration in place of father, when Emperor Kogyoku was ascended to the throne.
In AD 642, when his minister father SOGA no Emishi was in his late years, he took charge of national administration in place of father, when Emperor Kogyoku ascended the throne.
In AD 642, when his minister father SOGA no Emishi was in his late years, he took charge of national administration in place of father, when Emperor Kogyoku ascended the throne.

sen.j: 同年7月23日には従者が白色のスズメの雛を手に入れた。
sen.e: On July 23 of the same year, his attendant obtained the baby bird of a white sparrow.
On July 23 of the same year, his attendant obtained the baby bird of a white sparrow.
On July 23 of the same year, his attendant obtained the baby bird of a white sparrow.

sen.j: 雀は祖父の蘇我馬子を表された事があるとされている。
sen.e: It is assumed that the sparrow was representing his grandfather SOGA no Umako.
It is assumed that the sparrow was representing his grandfather SOGA no Umako.
It is assumed that the sparrow was representing his grandfather SOGA no Umako.

sen.j: 翌643年（皇極天皇2年）の10月6日には父から独断で大臣を譲られる。
sen.e: On October 6 of AD 643 (the next year), the post of minister was transferred by his father out of his arbitrary decision.
On October 6 of AD 643 (the next year), the post of minister was transferred by his father out of his arbitrary decision.
On October 6 of AD 643 (the next year), the post of minister was transferred by his father out of his arbitrary decision.

sen.j: これにより、実質的にも形質的にも蘇我氏の家督を継いだという見方がある。
sen.e: As a result, there is a viewpoint that reigns of the family were virtually and substantially succeeded by the Soga clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: As a result, there is a viewpoint that reigns of the family were virtually and substantially succeeded by the Soga clan.
As a result, there is a viewpoint that reigns of the family were virtually and substantially succeeded by the Soga clan.

sen.j: しかし、この頃聖徳太子以来、皇室の周辺に国政を天皇中心に改革せんとする気運が強まったとされた。
sen.e: However, around this period, there was a strong cry among the imperial households for a reform of national administration centering on the emperor since the period of Prince Shotoku.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, around this period, there was a strong cry among the imperial households for a reform of national administration centering on the emperor since the period of Prince Shotoku.
However, around this period, there was a strong cry among the imperial households for a reform of national administration centering on the emperor since the period of Prince Shotoku.

sen.j: 入鹿はこのような動きを押さえ蘇我氏の縁の強い古人大兄皇子を天皇につけようと図った。
sen.e: Iruka suppressed such movements and attempted to attach Prince Furuhito no Oe no Miko, who was strongly related to the Soga clan, to the emperor.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Iruka suppressed such movements and attempted to attach Prince Furuhito no Oe no Miko, who was strongly related to the Soga clan, to the emperor.
Iruka suppressed such movements and attempted to attach Prince Furuhito no Oe no Miko, who was strongly related to the Soga clan, to the emperor.

sen.j: しかし、そのために邪魔になる聖徳太子の王子、山背大兄王ら上宮王家の人々を自殺に追い込んだ。
sen.e: However, he drove those obstructive people in Jogu Oke (royal families) such as Prince Shotoku's son, Prince Yamashiro no Oe to suicide.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, he drove those obstructive people in Jogu Oke (royal families) such as Prince Shotoku's son, Prince Yamashiro no Oe to suicide.
However, he drove those obstructive people in Jogu Oke (royal families) such as Prince Shotoku's son, Prince Yamashiro no Oe to suicide.

sen.j: 大臣を譲られてから1ヶ月も経たない11月上旬の事である。
sen.e: This happened at the beginning of November, which was less than one month after the post of minister was transferred to him.
This happened at the beginning of November, which was less than one month after the post of minister was transferred to him.
This happened at the beginning of November, which was less than one month after the post of minister was transferred to him.

sen.j: 644年（皇極天皇3年）11月には甘樫丘に邸宅を築き、これをぞれぞれ「上の宮門（みかど）」、「谷の宮門」とし、さらに自分の子女達を皇子と呼ばせた。
sen.e: In November of AD 644, he built the residences in Amagashino-oka Hill, named them respectively "Kaminomiya" (upper shrine) and "Tani no Miya-mon" (Palace Gate of Valley), and even called his own children princes.

In November of AD 644, he built the residences in Amagashino-oka Hill, named them respectively "Kaminomiya" (upper shrine) and "Tani no Miya-mon" (Palace Gate of Valley), and even called his own children princes.

In November of AD 644, he built the residences in Amagashino-oka Hill, named them respectively "Kaminomiya" (upper shrine) and "Tani no Miya-mon" (Palace Gate of Valley), and even called his own children princes.

sen.j: また、さらに畝傍山に要塞を築いた。
sen.e: Moreover, he built fortifications in Mt. Unebi-yama.
Moreover, he built fortifications in Mt. Unebi-yama.
Moreover, he built fortifications in Mt. Unebi-yama.

sen.j: これらについては『日本書紀』は蘇我氏の越権行為と批判している。
sen.e: About these, "Nohonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) criticized that the Soga clan was exceeding his authority.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: "Nohonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) criticized these moves saying that the Soga clan was exceeding its authority.
sen.cmt: these move saying にかえました。
sen.e: "Nohonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) criticized these moves saying that the Soga clan was exceeding its authority.

sen.j: しかし、同氏は元来開明的だった事もあり、唐や百済等当時の国際状況に対応する為だったとの意見、また、古人大兄皇子への皇位継承の準備固めの意味合いだったという意見もある。
sen.e: However, there were also opinions that, he was originally open discernment, his act was responding to the contemporary international circumstance such as Tang Dynasty and Paekche, or it was the preparation of succession to the Imperial Throne for Prince Furuhito no Oe no Miko.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, there were also opinions that, he was originally open discernment, his act was responding to the contemporary international circumstance such as Tang Dynasty and Paekche, or it was the preparation of succession to the Imperial Throne for Prince Furuhito no Oe no Miko.

Some people believe that he was by nature open to adopting new ideas and practices, and that his actions were taken in response to the international circumstance of that time (i.e. during the Tang Dynasty in China and the Paekche Dynasty in Korea); others, however, believe that he was preparing the way for the succession to the Imperial Throne of Prince Furuhito no Oe no Miko.

sen.j: これらの政策により、入鹿は実質最高権力者としての地位を固め、その治世には人々は大いに畏敬し。
sen.e: By these policies, Iruka strengthened his position substantially as the most powerful man, people revered him very much under his reign.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: By these policies, Iruka strengthened his position substantially as the most powerful man and people revered him very much under his reign.
By these policies, Iruka strengthened his position substantially as the most powerful man and people revered him very much under his reign.

sen.j: 道に落ちているものも拾わなくなったと言われた。
sen.e: It was said that people even did not pick up things which had fallen on the road.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It was said that people even did not pick up things which had fallen on the road.
It was said that people even did not pick up things which had fallen on the road.

sen.j: しかし、そのような入鹿の天下は長くは続かなかった。
sen.e: However, such whole country of Iruka did not continue long.
However, such world of Iruka did not continue long.
However, such world of Iruka did not continue long.

sen.j: 古人大兄皇子の異母弟で、皇位継承のライバルだった中大兄皇子（後の天智天皇）・藤原鎌足らのいわゆる乙巳の変のクーデターによって、飛鳥板蓋宮の大極殿において皇極天皇の御前で暗殺された。
sen.e: He was assassinated in Daigoku-den Hall of Asuka Itabuki no Miya Palace in front of Emperor Kogyoku by FUJIWARA no Kamatari and his rivals in succession to the Imperial Throne, such as Prince Naka no Oe no Oji (later Emperor Tenchi), who was Prince Furuhito no Oe no Miko's younger brother with a different mother, that is, by the coup d'Etat of Isshi no hen (the Murder in the Year of Isshi).

He was assassinated in Daigoku-den Hall of Asuka Itabuki no Miya Palace in front of Emperor Kogyoku by FUJIWARA no Kamatari and his rivals in succession to the Imperial Throne, such as Prince Naka no Oe no Oji (later Emperor Tenchi), who was Prince Furuhito no Oe no Miko's younger brother with a different mother, that is, by the coup d'Etat of Isshi no hen (the Murder in the Year of Isshi).

He was assassinated in Daigoku-den Hall of Asuka Itabuki no Miya Palace in front of Emperor Kogyoku by FUJIWARA no Kamatari and his rivals in succession to the Imperial Throne, such as Prince Naka no Oe no Oji (later Emperor Tenchi), who was Prince Furuhito no Oe no Miko's younger brother with a different mother, that is, by the coup d'Etat of Isshi no hen (the Murder in the Year of Isshi).

sen.j: 従兄弟に当たる蘇我倉山田石川麻呂が上表文を読み上げていた際、肩を震わせていた事に不審がっていた所を中大兄皇子と佐伯子麻呂に斬り付けられた。
sen.e: When his cousin SOGANOKURA-YAMADA no Ishikawamaro read out the Johyobun (memorial to the Emperor), his trembling was noted as suspicious, but this was cut by Prince Naka no Oe no Oji and SAEKI no Komaro.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: When his cousin SOGANOKURA-YAMADA no Ishikawamaro read out the Johyobun (memorial to the Emperor), his trembling was noted as suspicious, but this was cut by Prince Naka no Oe no Oji and SAEKI no Komaro.

When his cousin SOGANOKURA-YAMADA no Ishikawamaro read out the Johyobun (memorial to the Emperor), his trembling was noted as suspicious, but this was cut by Prince Naka no Oe no Oji and SAEKI no Komaro.

sen.j: 天皇に無罪を訴えるも、あえなく止めを刺された。
sen.e: Though he appealed his innocence to the emperor, but he was executed.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Though he appealed his innocence to the emperor, he was executed.
Though he appealed his innocence to the emperor, he was executed.

sen.j: 雨が降る外に遺体を打ち捨てられたという。
sen.e: It is said that his corpse was discarded outside and hit by the rain.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It is said that his corpse was discarded outside and hit by the rain.
It is said that his corpse was discarded outside and hit by the rain.

sen.j: 後日、父・蝦夷も自殺し、ここに蘇我宗本家は滅びる。
sen.e: Some days later, his father Ezo also commited suicide, and the main Soga family was ruined here.
Some days later, his father Ezo also commited suicide, and the main Soga family was ended here.
Some days later, his father Ezo also commited suicide, and the main Soga family was ended here.

sen.j: この後も従兄弟の石川麻呂とその弟の蘇我赤兄が大臣を務める
sen.e: Even after this, his cousin Ishikawamaro and his younger brother SOGA no Akae served as the minister.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Even after this, his cousin Ishikawamaro and his younger brother SOGA no Akae served as the minister.
Even after this, his cousin Ishikawamaro and his younger brother SOGA no Akae served as the minister.

sen.j: しかし、赤兄が壬申の乱で流罪になって以降は、蘇我氏（石川氏）は納言・参議まで出世するのがやっとというクラスにまで低下し、かつての栄光は戻らないまま、平安時代初期には公卿が出るのも途絶え、歴史から姿を消す事になる。
sen.e: After Akae became banishment in the Jinshin Rebellion, Soga (Ishikawa) managed to succeed to nagon (councilor) and Sangi (councilor), his glory before did not returned, the Soga clan discontinued from the high court nobles at the beginning of Heian period and disappeared from the history.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: After Akae was banished in the Jinshin Rebellion, Soga (Ishikawa) managed to succeed to nagon (councilor) and Sangi (councilor), his glory before did not return, and the Soga clan discontinued from the high court nobles at the beginning of Heian period and disappeared from history.

After Akae was banished in the Jinshin Rebellion, Soga (Ishikawa) managed to succeed to nagon (councilor) and Sangi (councilor), his glory before did not return, and the Soga clan discontinued from the high court nobles at the beginning of Heian period and disappeared from history.

sen.j: 入鹿の暗殺とそれに続く蘇我本宗家の滅亡に関して、近年では、改革の主導権争いを巡る蘇我氏と皇族や反蘇我氏勢力との確執が暗殺のきっかけになったとする見方がある。
sen.e: Concerning the assassination of Iruka and the ruin of head family of the Soga family that followed the incident, there was in recent years a viewpoint that the fights over the reform leadership between the Soga clan and the imperial families and the anti-Soga power had become the start of the assassination.

Concerning the assassination of Iruka and the ruin of head family of the Soga family that followed the incident, there was in recent years a viewpoint that the fights over the reform leadership between the Soga clan and the imperial families and the anti-Soga power had become the start of the assassination.

Concerning the assassination of Iruka and the ruin of head family of the Soga family that followed the incident, there was in recent years a viewpoint that the fights over the reform leadership between the Soga clan and the imperial families and the anti-Soga power had become the start of the assassination.

sen.j: また、蘇我入鹿という名前は、中大兄皇子（後の天智天皇）と中臣鎌足（後の藤原鎌足）によって、これまでの名前を資料とともに消され、卑しい名前として彼らが勝手に名付けたものであるという説もある（門脇禎二ら説）。
sen.e: Moreover, concerning the name of SOGA no Iruka, theories said that Prince Naka no Oe no Oji (later Emperor Tenchi) and NAKATOMI no Kamatari (later FUJIWARA no Kamatari) erased all the materials about his current name and they named a humble name arbitrarily (theories of Teiji KADOWAKI and others).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Moreover, concerning the name of SOGA no Iruka, theories said that Prince Naka no Oe no Oji (later Emperor Tenchi) and NAKATOMI no Kamatari (later FUJIWARA no Kamatari) erased all the materials about his current name and they named a humble name arbitrarily (theories of Teiji KADOWAKI and others).

Moreover, concerning the name of SOGA no Iruka, theories said that Prince Naka no Oe no Oji (later Emperor Tenchi) and NAKATOMI no Kamatari (later FUJIWARA no Kamatari) erased all the materials about his current name and they named a humble name arbitrarily (theories of Teiji KADOWAKI and others).

sen.j: しかし、これには反証が試みられている（加藤謙吉）。
sen.e: However, there were also attempted counter evidence to this (Kenkichi KATO).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, there were also attempted counter evidence to this (Kenkichi KATO).
However, there were also attempted counter evidence to this (Kenkichi KATO).

sen.j: 飛鳥寺境内と甘樫丘にほど近い場所に、「入鹿の首塚」が存在する。
sen.e: Close to Asuka-dera Temple precincts and Amagashino-oka Hill, there is the Iruka's Head Tomb.
There is the Iruka's Head Tomb close to Asuka-dera Temple precincts and Amagashino-oka Hill.
There is the Iruka's Head Tomb close to Asuka-dera Temple precincts and Amagashino-oka Hill.

sen.j: また、2005年11月13日に奈良県明日香村において、蘇我入鹿邸跡とみられる遺構が発掘された。
sen.e: Moreover, on November 13, 2005, a monument thought to be SOGA no Iruka was excavated in Nara Prefecture Asuka-mura Village.
Moreover, on November 13, 2005, a monument thought to be SOGA no Iruka was excavated in Nara Prefecture Asuka-mura Village.
Moreover, on November 13, 2005, a monument thought to be SOGA no Iruka was excavated in Nara Prefecture Asuka-mura Village.
